comment: easily one of the best math teachers at kennesaw . Makes classes engaging , and prepares you well for the exams . Take him if you want a A
Genuinely the GOAT

Dr. Riely made Calc 3 actually fun, I was excited to go to every class, and exams were pretty stress free as he gave a ton of practice material. The average for each exam was in the high 80s or low 90s. There was not a single question on the exams that was not fair game. Just listen to everyone and sign up for his class this man is a GEM.

Dr. Riely's welcoming and supportive approach to Calc III makes the class feel more engaging. Zoom recordings and live streams add flexibility to the learning experience. Lecture slides are available for notetaking during class. Exams are based on homework; they are graded fairly and on time. The pace of the lectures was ideal for comprehension.

Great professor, Lectures were optional meaning you can go in person or jut attend Zoom. The homework was very short and easy to do. Very clear instructions and great at explaining things. And the tests were short and easier compared to other Calc 1 professors. Take him if you can, he really is the best Calc Professor at KSU.

literally made calc 1 soooo easy and enjoyable man. hw is rlly easy just 1 or 2 like 12 question assignments everyweek on achieve. the optional weekyly quizzes he gives are identical from the test, he even pulls questions directly from the quizzes so if you do those you will 100% get an A in the class, rlly funny and nice too!

Great professor! He explains difficult concepts clearly and really helps you understand the material. As long as you attend class, do the homework, and keep up with the weekly quizzes, you'll do well.

Awesome professor! There are 3 tests and 1 final exam (no midterm). Weekly homework is on Achieve. Optional practice quizzes are super helpful and really prepare you for the tests—they helped me earn an A. Attendance isn't required but highly recommended if you want help and to do well. I got an A by attending lectures and doing quizzes.

Prof. Riely is goated. He gives partial credit on the paper exams he designs himself, and he gave us a bunch of easy extra credit that helps balance out the difficulty of the common final exam. Best part of his class is that he does his classes in person and on Zoom, and he posts the recordings so you can watch the lectures whenever you need to.

Just trust everyone on here, he is the GOAT for a reason. Calc 2 is not an easy class, but its not as bad as everyone makes it out to be. Do the weekly quizzes (he doesn't grade them) and you will breeze past this class. 4 exams, lowest gets replaced by final if it improves your grade. Good Luck o7
He offers non-graded quizzes that align well with the material on the tests and offers virtual lectures when you can't make it to class. Worth taking

I love Dr. Riely! He is kind, funny, and passionate about math. I wish he was teaching my next math course!! He gives optional quizzes to follow along with the content that really help with the tests. He's awesome

Easily the best professor I ever had here. Made both Calc 2 & 3 easy to understand. You shouldn't skip his lectuers as he always gives good tips on how to do problems but he does record all his lectures. As long as you do the quizzes without any help, you'll get an easy A. He also gives loads of help outside of class.

His lectures were in person with an online option, and he always recorded and uploaded the lectures. He can sometimes be slow in explaining a topic, but is open and willing to help anyone who is struggling. Has optional quizzes posted for each class, and the 3 exams and final pull questions exactly from the quizzes. He's a great professor!

The class was not difficult, but the lectures usually go pretty slow and can get confusing at times. Lots of self teaching. There were about 4 tests including the final, but he is pretty merciful when it comes to grading. He records all classes, so you don't have to show up. If you do all of your homework and use the study guides you will pass!

Do the study guides and you'll pass the exams just fine. He genuinely cares and gives very understandable lectures. I did almost all the homework assignments, which it's math so, yes you'll want to rip your hair out sometimes, but the payoff is a good grade. If he was teaching a calculus 1 class this semester, I would have taken it!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: If you need a good professor take bro.

I would say he does care about his students. Everything was done on Aleks, which we did have some thing due almost every week. He records his lectures and hosts zoom meetings. Exams are taken in person or online(your choice). Sometimes he goes into too much detail or overexplains things, but personally aleks made learning the material easier.
All lectures were available via Zoom. Dr. Riely is one of the best math professors I have ever had. He is funny, approachable, and explains difficult concepts very well. I highly recommend his class.

His discrete math class was amazing. He really broke down the concepts, definitions, and notation in a clear way. Online homework and 3 of the best 4 exams (counting the final) make up your entire grade, but if you can do the in-class exercises without assistance then you are set for the exams.
One of the best professors in this college. A passionate teacher. Loves what he's doing and cares about his students. He explains everything well in simple terms.

I was told before doing Calc 2 it would be the hardest class I ever took. Well this professor changed that automatically. Not only is he very informative but also makes the material really simple. There is loads of homework and quizzes but if you really take your time to do both (especially the quizzes), It's gonna be a easy A tbh.

Currently taking him for sets/logic/proofs class this semester and he really lives up to the reviews. He's amazing at relating the topics to other concepts in math/coding and real life that keep the lectures interesting. He can also tell if the class isn't picking an idea up and tries his best to explain it in a different way. Highly recommend him!

He is very nice and clearly knows a lot about math and cares but i honestly think he's too smart for his own good when it comes to teaching. I think he doesn't explain things in a digestible way when we need to know it but he over explains identities and concepts that we don't need to understand to the extent he explains them. grades generously tho

Prof. Riely is awesome. The lectures are engaging, and the homework and practice problems help a TON for the exams. The exams are standard difficulty, and he grades them pretty generously. Plus, all lectures are available online through zoom in case you can't make it to class. Definitely would recommend taking him!

BEST/NICEST PROFESSOR! There is a bit of hw every week but not bad at all. Test are very easy and he gives u the easy problems. He does zoom calls incase you can not come in person. He makes everything simple and doesn't overload with information. All the problems on test are ones you have seen multiple times. Best math professor, TAKE HIM!

Dr. Riely is the best math professor I've had so far at KSU. He really enjoys teaching math and as a result his lectures aren't boring. If you're not able to make it to class he always records and does zoom for each class. With the weekly quizzes, practice exams, and extra credit it's hard not to succeed in his class.

Dr. Riely is an amazing professor: he teaches at a great speed for learning w/o getting bored or behind and is generous with partial credit on exams. Weekly hw (drops 2 lowest), 2 nongraded quizzes a week, 3 exams, and a cumulative final (which could replace your lowest exam if it's better). Practice problems + quizzes are great study for exams!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Riely does an amazing job teaching mathematics at all levels. He makes the lectures interesting, the content easy to digest, and his tests arent't overwhelmingly difficult. KSU is lucky to have a professor as good as him.

This is my second time taking MATH2345 and professor Riely was awesome. Although he may get off topic at times, he teaches very clear and does not grade harsh at all. He also webcasts his classes on zoom so you can attend from home or watch the lecture later. I only got a C bc i didnt attend class much as he teaches most in his lectures.

This professor was amazing! Just the basic calc course load, homework per unit and 3 tests and a final. But he gives optional weekly practice quizzes which mimics the questions on the test exactly. His lectures were very helpful and did not have formula sheets for tests but with how his lectures were, I did not feel that I needed one.
Pr. Henry Riely is just the best. Lectures are awesome, plenty of homework (graded and ungraded for practice). The best lecturer for Calculus, objectively.

I am in love with this man. He is the best professor and my favorite professor. His exams are easy. Homework is easy. He is nice and flexible. He is really close in age to most students(I think he is about late 20s). He is relatable. He loves reddit.

Dr. Riely is an amazing lecturer. He knows how to explain math topics and make them interesting. If you are struggling he is willingly to help. He also gives out weekly quizzes(not for a grade) that serve as extra practice and exam prep. If you can do the quizzes; you can do the tests. I honestly found the tests easier then the quizzes.
Professor Riely was incredible at both teaching and inspiring us to learn the material. He was the greatest professor I've ever had even in a class as difficult as calc 2.

Professor Riely is one of the best I have taken. My grade was poor for sure, and I have to retake the course, but he was quite understand and compassionate of the situation. I recommend taking him if you can. The course is homework heavy, and it is 25% of your grade. There are 3 exams worth 15%, and the final is worth 30%.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Riely is an incredibly smart and helpful teacher that genuinely cares about helping you understand the subject. He made the subject easily accessible and I found his lectures so interesting that I decided to pick up a math minor. I felt like I could ask any question without judgement, and as long as you do the weekly quizzes you'll be set

Genuinely the best Calc professor I've ever had! He is such a nice guy who will go out of his way to help you learn! If you want to pass his class, make sure to show up to every lecture, and do the weekly homework (which is worth 25% of your grade)! Professor Riely is a SAINT when it comes to grading tests. Take him if you have the chance!

I took him over the Summer. Pretty much weekly homework for 30% of grade. 2 exams each worth 20% and Final is worth 30%. Gives a quiz over the lecture. If you can complete all of them unassisted, I would say you have an extremely high chance of acing the exam. They are very similar. He is extremely extremely smart too. It's a straightforward class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Riely is awesome, he found a way to take Calc I and make it a class that I looked forward to attending each week. He does a great job at setting you up in a position to succeed, his weekly quizzes resemble his tests. His lectures are great and he has an energetic personality. He's very knowledgeable as well. If you put in effort, you can do wel
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Riely is a very fun teacher and I enjoyed his class. He's a great teacher but doesn't do enough practice problems imo. His tests tho are of the hardest topics possible, he also is a very tough grader and isn't quick to give out points after talking about the grade received. However he is much better than my previous Calc 1 teacher. Study hard.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Riely is the best math teacher I have ever had! Math is hard but this guy knows so much! Every other math teacher I have ever had never explained anything. He is a young nerdy professor who clearly loves math. I was an IT major previously but because of him I have decided to switch to computer science and tackle calculus II next semester!

I failed calculus before because i fell behind really early and the professor i had before him was stuck up and refused to really help me, his excuse was "I lacked fundamental math skills" and that most of his students took calc 1 2 or 3 times. I havent recieved my final grade for this class yet but im hopeful that this time i pass. 10/10 recommend

Dr. Riely is a really friendly guy and his class isn't too work intensive. However, his tests are some of the hardest in the department as I learned by seeing the tests my friends were receiving in the same course with different professors. Prepare to answer the hardest questions possible for each subject. And no rounding up(I got a 69 and failed)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: this was prof rielys first year teaching at ksu and he did a great job. 2 homeworks a week and 4 tests. he is willing to work with you if you are struggling or miss something. very funny in class which is nice since math can be draining. 11/10
